TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PropertyTabChangedEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the event of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertyTabChanged> event occurs when the user selects a new property tab in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid>.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyTabChangedEventArgs> provides data on the old tab and new tab being selected.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this type. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertyTabChanged> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> named `PropertyGrid1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertyTabChanged> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#531](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#531)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#531](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#531)]
